metadata.title: CVE-2021-46924 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: NFC:st21nfca: Fix memory leak in device probe and remove 'phy->pending_skb' isalloced when device probe, but forgot to free in the error handling pathand remove path, this cause memory leak as follows: unreferenced object0xffff88800bc06800 (size 512): comm "8", pid 11775, jiffies 4295159829 (age9.032s) hex dump (first 32 bytes): 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 0000 00 00 ................ 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 00................ backtrace: [<00000000d66c09ce>]__kmalloc_node_track_caller+0x1ed/0x450 [<00000000c93382b3>]kmalloc_reserve+0x37/0xd0 [<000000005fea522c>] __alloc_skb+0x124/0x380[<0000000019f29f9a>] st21nfca_hci_i2c_probe+0x170/0x8f2 Fix it by freeing'pending_skb' in error and remove.
